trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderHandling"></xref> class is used to get, set, write, and read SOAP header content to and from SOAP messages.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderHandling"></xref>.
Checks to ensure that the SOAP headers that must be understood have been understood; if not, this method throws an exception.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderCollection"></xref> that contains the SOAP headers.
A SOAP header that must be understood was not understood.
Gets the SOAP header content for the specified SOAP message.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderCollection"></xref> that contains the SOAP headers.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the SOAP message.
An array of type <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderMapping"></xref> that contains the mappings for the SOAP headers.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderDirection"></xref> value that indicates the direction of the SOAP headers.
This parameter is currently not used.
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the SOAP header content of the SOAP message.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> to be used in writing the headers.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer"></xref> to be used in reading the headers.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderCollection"></xref> that contains the SOAP headers.
An array of type <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderMapping"></xref> that contains the mappings for the SOAP headers.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderDirection"></xref> value that indicates the direction of the SOAP headers.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the namespace for the SOAP message envelope.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the encoding style for the SOAP headers.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> that indicates whether to check for the required SOAP headers.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the SOAP header content of the SOAP message.
Sets the SOAP header content for the specified SOAP message.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderCollection"></xref> that contains the SOAP headers.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the SOAP message.
An array of type <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderMapping"></xref> that contains the mappings for the SOAP headers.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderDirection"></xref> value that indicates the direction of the SOAP headers.
This parameter is currently not used.
Writes the specified SOAP header content to the SOAP message.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to be used in writing the headers.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer"></xref> to be used in writing the headers.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderCollection"></xref> that contains the SOAP headers to be written.
An array of type <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderMapping"></xref> that contains the mappings for the SOAP headers.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderDirection"></xref> value that indicates the direction of the SOAP headers.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> that indicates whether the SOAP headers are encoded.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the default namespace for the XML Web service.
A <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> that indicates whether data sent to and from the XML Web service is encoded by default.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the namespace for the SOAP message envelope.
Writes the specified SOAP header content to the SOAP message.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> to be used in writing the headers.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeaderCollection"></xref> that contains the SOAP headers to be written.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the namespace for the SOAP message envelope.
